reviews.text: A fantanstic two night three day break packing as much in a possible. Spent time in all the classes, enjoying wonderful food and all the facilities.
reviews.title: March Sunshine Break!

reviews.text: I love Champneys, so much I have been back 5 times with loyalty vouchers and the only reason I'm not going again in 6 months is that I don't have enough holiday left! I will be back but my Mum will keep the loyalty going in the meantime as she's retired!
reviews.title: Fabulous stay at Champneys, Tring

reviews.text: I took my daughter for a one night stay for her 21st birthday treat as she had never visited Champneys before. The staff at Tring are very helpful and friendly and nothing is too much trouble. We both had a massage and facial which were excellent. After a delicious dinner, our waitress appeared at the table with a beautiful birthday cake with a candle which was a complete surprise to both of us! A lovely touch. We both had a good night's sleep and had a good day on the Saturday. The facilities are excellent and we managed to pack in a lot over the 2 days. Sauna, steam room, outdoor whirlpool, swimming, pilates and a country hike! We both had a great time and my daughter's looking forward to a return visit.
reviews.title: Really good experience

reviews.text: I really enjoyed my week stay at Tring, I exceeded my weight loss goals and had some lovely treatments. The surroundings were superb, the staff were helpful and friendly. The building was well-maintained and very warm and welcoming. My room was lovely, clean and comfortable. The food was excellent. I shall definitely go again!
reviews.title: Beautiful day at Champneys, Tring

reviews.text: I had a day at Champneys at part of a relaxing day with female members of my family and to say it wasn't what I expected would be an understatement. We pulled in to the beautiful grounds and were greeted by well presented staff at reception where we were led though to have morning tea in the drawing room. The staff all day were so freindly and were a great advertisement for the top class treatments I recieved here. The grounds and the spa itself were breathtaking and the treatments I recieved were much needed and given by very poilte ladies who were pleasant to talk to at just the right times. The food was fabulous at lunch and the service I recieved all day in each of the sections left me smiling most of the day. It was clean and faultless through out. I had a very very nice day and would highly recommend this place to anyone.
reviews.title: Fantastic! Such a beautiful place and a relaxing day.

reviews.text: We stayed for one night in May over the weekend.
reviews.title: Not exclusive by any means

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The receptionist we had was awful, we checked in at 11am as advised when booking and was told we were too early. She eventually told us we could use the spa but wouldn't allow us access to our suitcases to retrieve our swimsuits!! Luckily another member of staff interveaned and we were allowed access to our property!! After this, she told us to come back to reception at 3pm to be shown around (obviously we didn't bother). She then gave us incorrect directions to our room which had us wandering around for ages trying to find it, once we did the keys didn't work, so we had to go back to reception...
reviews.title: Very basic luxury

reviews.text: As a result of not being shown around we had to discover things such as needing to book lunch and dinner, where to go for treatments, etc ourselves.
reviews.title: 24 hrs made a world of difference!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lunch and dinner were OK but much like what you would get in an all inclusive hotel in Tenerife, so not exclusive at all. The spa facilities, were again OK but nothing special, the room was bland and much like any other hotel. The staff were friendly and walks around the grounds were good.
reviews.title: fantastic spa weekend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The thing is, Champneys are selling high turnover, low overhead packages to the masses. This was clearly apparent as soon as I saw lunch. This is fine but don't sell it as exclusive, because it is far from it. We paid in total around £600 for a one night stay (2 people) plus treatments, snacks, coffee, etc. I thought this was steep considering the "mass produced package holiday style" stay it was.
reviews.title: Everyone needs a little time out!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just spent another wonderful weekend at Champney's Tring, celebrating my wife's Birthday and our anniversay. The staff, facilities and quality of the food were excellent. Any minor problems were soon resolved by the attentive staff. A totally relaxing experience and I would recommend Tring to anyone needing a chill out weekend with a large dose of luxury. Well done.
reviews.title: Another fantastic experience

reviews.text: Had a lovely evening at Champneys Tring enjoying the Spa facilities. Greeted by a lovely gentleman(we think he was French) in the main reception who checked us in at the Spa and gave us our robes and slippers. He then took us on a little tour around the facilities. Spa facilities are very nice, it wasn't too busy so we could use everything. It would be nice to come back during the day in the summer to enjoy the sunbeds and cafe. Tring only do a evening offer of spa and dinner on a Thursday. The jacuzzi outside was a real treat - considering it was a little nippy outside. Had a pedicure and the beautician was very friendly. 3 course dinner was delicious, not too much so you don't feel full. Overall I would recommend the evening spa treat for any birthday present etc. and will be coming back again.
reviews.title: Evening spa treat

reviews.text: I have visited all the other Champneys resorts and this was my first visit to Tring. It truely exceeded my expectations - it is by far the best resort! The staff went above and beyond to ensure that we had an enjoyable stay and nothing was too much trouble. The facililties are excellent and the grounds are stunning. We have booked to return on the loyalty voucher scheme and we can't wait!
reviews.title: An excellent day!

reviews.text: Spent the day at Champneys Tring on March 24th and had the most wonderfully relaxing time. As soon as you walked into the entrance you felt that you were being pampered with a welcoming reception, cup of tea in the drawing room and then the guided tour. The times for the treatments booked were perfectly arranged so that we could make the most of the day. I can highly recommend the amazing Dry Floatation which gave me the best sleep I had in ages, and the fabulous facial that I had in the afternoon.
reviews.title: Fabulous Spa Day!!

reviews.text: The lunch was lovely with plenty to choose from, and we had tea and cake at 3pm after lying in the sunshine reading the magazines and newspapers that were available (we were very lucky with the weather that day!!) We were the only 2 people in the pool when we first arrived, and all the other facilities were great too! The only thing that was missing was body lotion in the changing rooms but you can always bring your own. When we left at 6pm we felt that we were totally revitalised and rested, and will definitely return in the future.
reviews.title: Not the best....

reviews.text: Champneys Tring is an excellent spa resort. Fantastic hotel, views and facilities. All the staff are so helpfull and cannot do enough for you. Lovely food, not the 'lettice leaf' that people automatically think you can only eat at a health spa. An overall brilliant experiance. I have been to Tring and Springs on many occasions and Champneys have never let me down.
reviews.title: Lola

reviews.text: I have been to this resort seven times over the last 3 years and it is by far my favourite spa. I love the luxurious country house feel to it. The staff are all excellent, the rooms in the Mansion are beautiful & perfectly good in the newer part. The restaurant is fabulous, excellent fresh food, the dining staff are curteous. The therapists are all very good as they are all trained at Champneys College. I just LOVE this place and would be a member if I could afford it!!!
reviews.title: Fabulous Spa Resort

reviews.text: This was my second visit in six months to Champneys Tring and the window on the landing still hadn't been repaired (the draught through it in the winter must have been shocking). This time we had a premier room, well appointed and comfortable but the TV wasn't working and the sliding doors in the wardrobe needed a hefty lift back onto the rails each time we opened them. Breakfast and lunch are self-service which can result in bottle necks as guests wait for clean crockery and breakfast items. One one occasion we were told the museli had 'run out' - surely this is a par stock item? Dinner is waiter service and whilst the staff are well intentioned, they are not professionally trained so service can be inconsistent and a little flustered. The food though is very good and whilst a previous reviewer had problems with left-overs being used the next day, most of us found this completely acceptable and a couple of times I was very impressed by the chef's inovation.
reviews.title: It's all in the detail

reviews.text: The gym facilities and classes are excellent and we loved the early morning walk and the post-prandial hike. I am a massage fanatic, have had massages all over the world and the 55-minute massage at Champneys was right up there in my top five.
reviews.title: Did us all the world of good

reviews.text: Without exception all the staff came across as genuinely wanting everyone to have a pleasant and relaxing stay, it's just these small details that let it down. In both my stays I didn't ever see anyone who seemed to be the General or Duty Manager present and it could really do with someone senior walking the resort and talking to guests every day.
reviews.title: Grandeur living in the lap of luxury
